chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to play?
ready!
¡impresionante! Entonces, estoy al principio junto a esta ramita que apunta a una pequeña isla.
Veo un tigre allí. ¿Adónde vamos ahora?
cruza la línea de árboles con el loro, pasa por las rocas hacia la rana y cruza a la izquierda el caimán. Ve hacia la jirafa y desciende hasta el cofre.
understood! passing tiger island towards parrot island now. now I see the frog after the 3 rocks
To the left of the frog, there is a crocodile. ooh, it looks dangerous! maybe take a quick step here?
quick step indeed
¡Uf, acabo de pasar el cocodrilo sin ser almuerzo! y ah, de vuelta a la isla elefante
Ahora, dirigiéndonos a la jirafa, ¿verdad?
Si
yup, llegué a la giraffe ahora
¿adonde desde aquí?
Ve la serpiente, y el tesoro está más allá.
Now I see the snake, I head towards the two stages to the east
Correct
¡genial, estoy emocionado! veo el tesoro ahora
*finished* ¡gano! gracias, eso fue divertido

chat.msg: hey!!! ya comenzamos?
Hola! Let's do this!
perfect! so you're at the top-right corner with the white dog, right? ok, take a few steps to your left, go under that wooden bench and cross the trail towards where the florist stand is
Im there
alright, awesome! now, instead of going to the florist, make a u-turn to your left like a speedy race car, cross that trail again and head back to that cute white dog
are you doing that u-turn?
here
sweet! now, head south, past our furry friend, and keep going south until you spot another white dog chilling by a red and white checkered picnic mat
here
excellent! now, walk over the mat, making sure you step by the bowl of berries
once you pass it, start heading west
gotcha
fantastic! now, see that wooden branch coming up? it's crossing the river from your left to your right
cross over it, heading north
there
¡impresionante! Ahora, ¿ves ese arbusto verde? ¡No te acerques demasiado! Haz un círculo desde tu lado derecho hasta llegar al puesto de floristería.
did it
you're doing great! now, take a left turn, going under the florist stand and head towards the big bridge where two people are riding bikes
here
perfect! don't cross it just yet
go west, along the side of the bridge until you spot those two elderly people sitting on a bench reading newspapers
here
¡grandioso! Ahora desde allí, dirígete hacia el sur solo unos pasos, te encontrarás entre los viejos y otra rama, con un arbusto verde justo al final de la rama.
here
awesome! our next move, squeeze in between that branch and the green bush, moving eastward now

chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to go?
Hey! Listo cuando estas
¡genial! estoy en la tienda en el norte del mapa
¿por dónde sigo?

ve hacia el sur y haz un bucle debajo del perro. Haz un bucle sobre la parte superior del fuego y debajo del champiñón. Gire a la izquierda y rodee el arbusto frente al automóvil. Da la vuelta al telescopio y dirígete a la cabina.
okay, moving south, under the dog and over the fire. Now, I go under the mushroom, turn left, and go around the bush in front of the car.
I go around the telescope and straight onto the path to the cabin. We are fine like this?
yes
perfect! I am approaching the wooden house
Any other step or have we arrived?
you have arrived
¡fantástico! hemos llegado a la casa de madera
*finished*

chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to start?
Lets go
¡excelente! Primero, dirígete hacia el suroeste debajo de la primera palmera.
ahora, gire a la derecha, cruce la segunda palmera y gire a la izquierda antes del tercer árbol, luego continúe hacia el sur. ¿entiendo?
understood
¡genial! a continuación, ve a la izquierda de ese cachorro marrón que ves
luego, gira ligeramente a la izquierda y luego a la derecha, siempre hacia el sur. ¿estás avanzando bien?
gotcha
¡bien ahí! ahora pasa por entre esa gran roca a tu oeste y la roquita al este, eso te llevará al agua
¿listo para mojarte un poco?
totally
very good, friend
Now you are going to see a giant red crab. turn right, walk along the large rock and continue west into the water
done
good stuff! after moving along a third, medium-sized rock, you'll face a shark
don't worry, just make a sharp right turn
done
¡perfecto! ahora vuelve a la terra firme, pasando entre la roca mediana y una bola tricolor
sigue al norte. ¿cómo vamos usuario?
doing well
good job! now fly a little left and head northwest
done
Es hora de navegar entre esa carpa roja a la izquierda y el altavoz más grande a tu derecha, ¡vamos!
done
that is! Now go around the store in an arc and then continue south.
done
perfect! now, just before you reach the water, take a right and go under the red kayak
can you see it?

general_survey.answer: Yes. I had a French girlfriend.
general_survey.question: Have you ever lived in a home environment or country where your second language was spoken? If so, please explain briefly:
On a day-to-day basis, how likely are you to have a conversation using both your first and second languages?
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At work
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At home
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with friends
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with family
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Using social media
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
Do you enjoy mixing languages in conversation?

general_survey.answer: It is fun, as long as you understand, and it isn't used in an exclusionary way.
general_survey.question: What do you think when others mix languages in conversation? Please explain:
Any final comments about your language background?
